intro: Piper lundii, commonly known as the African pepper plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species. The plant is characterized by its vine-like growth habit and compound leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into spherical berries. The berries are typically harvested when they turn red and are used in traditional medicine and as a spice.
